comment: Trina Queen if a seems like a very kind person but OH MY GOODNESS HER WORKLOAD WAS HORRIBLE. If you're simply taking this class to receive a credit like I was do not do it. The workload is excessive for an introduction course and I was over it by the time this course is over. RUN!!!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I took her 4-week summer course. RUN!
Overall, great professor. The course is not terrible, with two main projects and a weekly discussion on films, which I found quite interesting. Highly recommend!!

it was a seven-week course, so it was faster past than most classes, overall, it was not bad besides her not grading past the second weeks stuff till after the finish date. group project wasn't that bad, she posts an example so that helped.
Lots of work due to being a 7 week course. All reading was power points and websites. Heavy emphasis on medical ethics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: This class is extremely disorganized and too much to expect for an intro class. There are two major writing assignments, a terminology test, and a group project worth about 1/3 of the grade. She doesn't respond to emails well and makes things much more complicated than it needs to be. Not worth the stress for an intro class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Queen was a nice and responsible professor. There is 3 discussion posts per week, a journal, and a major assignment due about every other week. This is taken in a short amount of time and can be difficult when you are taking heavier classes. Things can pile up quickly, be obedient on your schedule with this class. She has an O.K. response time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: I went out of my way to get Professor Queen because of these ratings. Her online course is incredibly disorganized as others have touched on but I underestimated how disorganized an online course could be. You just put the stuff online and it teaches itself! I got an A+ but probably wouldn't take her again.

I took this class online and it was one of the worst class since I was born. Materials are not organized at all and difficult to follow believe me. Take this class if it is your last class because you will meet a traffic jam. She takes some days off while students are struggling with questions and she replies emails after the due date.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Besides her being a little unorganized she is a really good professor. She designs the class so as long as you put in some sort of effort you pass. Her lectures are interesting and she is very passionate which makes it much more interesting. She grades last minute but as long as you attempted the assignment you should be okay.

Few discussions, 2 paper-like assignments, & code of ethics project. Heavily medically focused but assignments weren't too bad. Organization and clarity on what assignments were supposed to be wasn't great, rubrics can be confusing. Overall good class & prof, definitely would take for this class again.

Professor queen seems like a great person, I loved that her class was hybrid. But my biggest issue with her was that her syllabus was very SUBJECT TO CHANGE  I'm the kind of person who likes to know what the big assignments for a class are from the get-go. What they entail, when they're due, etc. She always seemed disorganized.

I loved her class! Take her if you can if you want an easy A! This is an 8 week course so there is a lot of work. But as long as you turn them in on time you will be fine. I really enjoyed her lectures and some of the topics throughout the course was very interesting! I will take her again for another course if I can.

7 week course so we had lots of work per week. It was pretty easy, but time-consuming. We had journal entries every week along with discussion posts (and 2 replies to other people). We also had a group project that I recommend starting right away since it is a lot of work. She didn't reply to emails/GroupMe as quickly, but she would eventually.

Very knowledgeable about medical ethics and constantly checked up on students to see if they had questions about the material. Understanding and kind, she offers extra credit and pushed back a few of our deadlines. Expect to do a fair amount of writing, though. Weekly discussion posts, a group project, and an essay. Solid pick in my book.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This class was fairly easy. We had a discussion post every week and had to respond to 2 other classmates. We also had a group project to do, and I suggest trying to work on it as soon as possible rather than last minute. There were also a few assignments and journal entries, and a final test.

Get ready to write. Weekly discussions and journals. Tests were simple enough (Take your time on the pre test!!). The Essay assignment was the only thing I didn't take seriously but I managaed to get a C. She's very understanding and lenient if you have any problems. No required textbook. Lockdown browser tests

TAKE HER FOR BIOETHICS. she was an easy grader as long as you do the work as she says to. there are 2 exams, two 1000 word essays and a 300 word journal due every sunday night which is you just giving your opinion and talking about what you learned this week. there is also a debate. overall easy class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Her class is interesting, she's nice, I highly recommend taking the class. There's a group project but you're able to grade your group members on how they helped and u don't have to present the project. Very simple directions, she was willing to extend deadlines, and was very understanding. Really great professor.

This class is definitely one of the best humanities you can take at KSU. This course is really easy if you remember to do assignments in time, and if you put in the effort. Discussion posts are weekly, and assignments/projects occur a few times. Even though the course is asynchronous, it is important to do the discussions for participation grades.

I took this class over a 4 week semester during the summer. Posted powerpoints. Required discussions over material. Had to do journals every week over articles and interesting videos/movies. Lenient grader. Fun group project. One exam (Vocab). Offers extra credit if needed. Easy A! Responds to emails! Take her! Especially over the summer!

I took Queen for bio ethics, and it was definitely the easiest class I had. It was nothing but journals (which you just had to give your opinion on the topic), and a debate, and a bunch of busy work. She's very sweet and helps you out if you need it. We had one project she pushed the due date back 3 months because we all struggled with it. Take her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She makes discussions a little to extra than they need to be. Personally, she's a great professor in the way that she's willing to spend the time with you to make sure you pass. However, this is really a "you have to read and not be taught by the professor" class. Otherwise, it's very easy class to take that offers many chances for extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: So sweet! She is passionate about her teachings and is so helpful. She is very considerate, especially with grading, and easy to work with. Fun class with mainly discussion post and a fun/easy group project. One of the best classes of college so far! 10/10 recommend!

Prof. Queen is very caring and willing to help you. For an online class, there is a group project that you should not wait to start on. The assignments are few, but very complicated and time consuming, so don't procrastinate these, and there's no late credit. As long as you stay on top and reach out to her, this is a very worthwhile course.

Professor Queen is one of my favorites so far. Her class is relatively easy as long as you do the homework which isnt a lot. One large group project and 2 papers. Her class is very interesting and sometimes she brings her pup which is always fun. She does do pop quizzes and attendance so go, but most of her lectures are easy going to just relax.

This class was extremely easy if you post the discussions. There was a group project and a paper but they're easy and she was always available when I had questions. The discussion posts are interesting and actually fun to write and research (same for the assignments).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: Did not like how she treated towards the end. It made it hard to participate and enjoy the class. Did not like the group project because of who was in it.

Trina Queen is a great professor! I took her class online and did not have one problem at all. I had a discussion post every week, a midterm, a paper, and a group assignment. She gives you chances to receive extra credit (even though you won't need it) and emails you back frequently! TAKE HER IF YOU CAN! It's an easy A, but you have to participate.

Professor Queen is a solid choice. The class is mostly discussion post with a easy group project and 3 easy papers. She responds to emails in a timely manner however not clear sometimes. She offers extra credit should you need it and is a very easy grader. Take her class if your looking for a GPA Boost while filling a requirement!

Professor Queens class is a ln easy class to get an A in and it can also change the way you look at world issues and society as a whole. Since it is an Ethics film class, you are required to watch 1 film every week and talk about it in class. The only hard things you have are the final group project, 4 assignments, and 2 case studies.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: This is one of the easiest classes you can take. She never responded to emails. However her class is so easy that you can figure It out. She gives extra credit. We had 3 papers, 1 group project and 2 discussion post a week.

Took this class online you only have two weekly discussion post where you make one post and another is responding to someone. You have 3 writing assignments that are easy 3-5 pages. A group project which is your final and it is basically a PowerPoint. Midterm is vocab that she gives you. Easy A take!!

Not sure how else to rate this professor. 2 Discussion post a week. 3 assignments all semester. One group project. That's pretty much it. Hard to get in contact with. Easy A if you stay on top of your work.

If you tried at all, you would most likely get a 100 on everything. Discussions every week, but fairly easy topics. There's a group project, but it takes no time at all. Three papers, which are the most time consuming thing about this class. Midterm was word for word. Kinda wish I didn't study for so long memorizing those definitions. No final.

Took Queen for STS. Class was discussion based and interesting. Attendance is a big part of your grade, theres 3 short essays, online quizzes, midterm, and group project. She took a long time to grade our work but grades everything easy, youll get an A if you go to class and turn in everything. I enjoyed this professor. Lots of extra credit.

Her online class is definitely an easy A. Two discussion posts a week, three papers throughout the semester and one group project. She's one of those professors who gives a 100 on everything, but she takes forever to put grades in. She's definitely hands off and you probably won't learn anything, but it's a good gpa booster!

Queen is a solid professor for the subject, but since it's online she doesn't have to facilitate much. Participation in online discussion is a MASSIVE part of the course. There were three papers and a group project as well. Papers aren't too bad as long as you put in the work.

There were three discussion posts each week related to medical or science technology. We were required to respond to two each week. She has a midterm which is a vocab quiz; super easy. The final project is a video presentation about code of ethics. There are three writing assignments 2-3 pages in length that she spreads thru the semester

I took this class online and it wad VERY easy, main participation is 2 discussion questions a week. Only negative is the teacher is very difficult to get a response from, and the directions on assignments are not always clear. Expect a week for email responses.

Great professor. Took her online. Had to post 2 discussion posts a week, had about 5 quizzes, one easy midterm, no tests, and 3 easy written assignment essays. Very good class to take. It was my "breather" for the semester. Doesn't answer emails very well, but you don't really need to email her much. She is pretty clear on all her instructions.

Very easy online class. Though sometimes you need to stay on top of it so you don't forget assignments. Theres weekly discussions you must do, as well as 3 pretty simple papers in the semester. Theres also a group project thats not too tough. Overall if you participate, do the discussions & turn everything in on time you should get an easy A.

Weekly discussions over 3 topics. Midterm was okay, you are given a study guide. No final. 3 assignments that are 2-3 page papers. And a group project on a code of ethics for every profession. This class was also confusing on what to do. It felt like we were forgetting to do something every week. Directions weren't the best for some assignments.

Queen makes her STS class very easy. Most classes are just open discussions on issues related to the topic. Attendance is worth a fourth of your grade, though, so you want to make it to every class. The textbook readings are supposed to be done outside of class, but there are not tests or quizzes from the book material so you don't even need it.

Queen made 2 hours feel quick due to the engagement and intriguing material in her class. I was weary entering Medical Ethics due to it being the only Honors course that didn't conflict with my major classes and the questionability of such a narrow subject. But due to using her material and her breadth of know-how, I found the class well-worth it.
One of the best professor to work with, she has the knowledge and will work with you, no matter the circumstances. I would recommend her to anyone.
Very interesting class.  All of the topics will make you think.  She makes you think about what you are talking about, but still grades easily.  It is strange doing a group project online though.
All around great professor. Keeps the class interesting despite the fact that people only take it because they have to.

Great Professor! ALways there to help out with students if need be, easy to understand, she always clarifies. Overall one of the best professors I have ever had thus far. Papers are easy to make a good grade on only if you properly read and follow her instructions. She made the class enjoyable always talking of controversial issues and what not.

Excellent professor. I was already interested in the subject matters but prof Queen made me love even more. She is so helpful, friendly and really make the class interesting. We learned a lot while having fun doing it. It is a class where you have to stay on track because there is an essay quiz on vista every week but you would have fun doing it

Prof. Queen is hilarious and I really enjoyed her class. She makes great use of Youtube and gives us interesting sites to check out. She even brought her puppy dog to the last class and gave us free donuts! Nuff said. Take the class!

I took STS 2400 Bioethics as an online course, and Prof Queen is hands down the most involved online instructor I've ever had.  She is willing to work with students provided they communicate with her.  Guided discussions are designed to challenge preconceived notions.  Chap Quizzes are hard, but only your 10 best grades (of 18) count.

I was late registering and this was the only class left.  I took it online. It sounded hard and boring but it ended up being fascinating.  Queen was EXCELLENT, helpful, friendly & knows the subject matter.  This class helped to hone my critical thinking skills.  Wonderful teacher!

The STS class I signed up for was canceled and I was put in this class (Bioethics). Subject was very depressing. Two required books and a lot of reading & writing each week. You teach yourself in this class. She is very slow to grade assignments and respond to emails. Unless this class relates to your major, pick something else.
